newsitem.title: USA: Magnesium shipments weaken in third quarter - IMA.
newsitem.headline: Magnesium shipments weaken in third quarter - IMA.

text.p: Primary magnesium shipments in the third quarter fell 3,600 tonnes from the same quarter last year, and were down 4,100 tonnes from the second quarter of 1996, the International Magnesium Association reported.
In the first nine months of 1996, shipments totaled 222,000 tonnes, down 5,400 tonnes from the total shipped in the same period last year.

This year's nine-month total comprised 170,900 tonnes shipped from Brazil, Canada, France, Norway and the U.S, plus estimated exports of 51,100 tonnes from the Commonwealth of Indepedent States and China.
The IMA estimated that exports in January through September from the CIS and China were up 26 percent, or 10,500 tonnes, to 51,100 tonnes compared to the previous period.
Magnesium inventory continued to rise in the third quarter, up 5,000 tonnes from the end of June to 38,400 tonnes.
In January through September, shipments for alloying aluminum, totaling 103,900 tonnes, were down 15,600 tonnes or 13 percent.

Shipments of 30,300 tonnes to the desulfurization market for purifying steel, were up by 5,700 tonnes or 23 percent, while shipments of 52,400 tonnes to the die casting sector - largely to make auto components - were up 5,400 tonnes or 11 percent.
Despite the weakening offtake and rising stocks, production in the first nine months rose by 1,700 tonnes to 186,500 tonnes.
